newsitem.title: USA: First Tennessee details reason for settlement.
newsitem.headline: First Tennessee details reason for settlement.

text.p: First Tennessee National Corp said Tuesday its unit settled litigation with the Department of Justice involving defaulted student loans because the case "had become so protracted and burdensome."

In a statement, the unit, First Tennessee Bank, said it "vigorously and unconditionally" denies any wrongdoing in the matter, in which it allegedly deceived the Education Department to get federal insurance on the defaulted loans.
It noted that the lawsuit was filed 10 years ago and that in agreeing to the settlement it did not admit to any liability. It also noted that no disciplinary action was taken against it.
Lew Weems, president of the unit, said the bank decided it was in the best interest of shareholders to settle.
"We are pleased that the matter is now at rest and we are able to focus our attention on our service commitment to the students of Tennessee," he said.
Earlier today, the Justice Department said the unit agreed to pay $2.75 million to settle the ligitation.
